page.title: 08MOUNTBATTEN WAY, CONGLETON
page.content: One part of Congleton which has changed in the past few years is around Park Street. Much of this area has been demolished and Mountbatten Way has taken its place. Many houses and shops have gone including a barber's and a funeral director's which is now in Bank Street. On Eaton Bank there was a theatre called "The Player's Hall". A new theatre called Daneside Theatre was finished in 1984 next to the river Dane.{Mountbatten {Way was built to keep the heavy {traffic out of the town centre,some of {which has now been pedestrianised.}The roundabouts at each end of Mountbatten Way are beautiful, the flowers and cuttings are grown by Mr Sherratt and his staff. He received the British Empire Medal in the Queen's Birthday Honours for his work.
